reviews.text: I stayed in the Uyan Hotel for 4 days in late November, 2006. Having read other reviews, I had my concerns. But, I must agree with those who had a very pleasant stay (and these folks seem to be in the majority).
reviews.title: Clean, Convenient and Charming

reviews.text: I was met at the airport as agreed. I was placed on the third floor in a Deluxe room with a king-sized bed, just as I reserved. There were no offensive smells or noises. On the contrary, the hardwood floors and bathroom tiles were gleaming, the bed was comfortable and everything worked properly. The breakfast served in the 4th floor breakfast room was not elaborate, but the food was fresh and plentiful. The other guests I observed also seemed to be enjoying their stay.
reviews.title: Ask for the sea view rooms on 4th floor

likes.liked: — Beautiful rooftop, after walking all day - great to have an elevator even to the roof, tapped into wifi in-room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found all of the front desk personnel to be very helpful, especially Osman. As others have noted, the location is excellent for sightseeing. Most tourists sites in Sultanahmet are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location....

likes.liked: — Location to historical sites and the Bosphorus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a 4 night stay at the Uyan hotel in October through Venere and after arranging the complimentary shuttle service from the airport to the hotel (by Email and confirming by phone) we where disappointed to find nobody at the airport to meet us, after locating a phone and waiting a further 1/2 hour we where eventually picked up. The room (205) we were assigned was the standard Deluxe which was clean and tidy even though there was no satellite reception to the TV. We complained about this and I believe as a token gesture the bell boy was sent to our room to say that they would get a tecnichen up to our room to fix it. As an ex TV engineer I could see that the room was not wired for Satellite and that the bell boy was sent to ''placate the tourists''. In view of this lack of customer care and having no faith that my complaint/issue would be resolved I could not be bothered to report the shower tray that constantly leaked and took 10 minutes to drain.
reviews.title: poor cutomer care

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In my mails and confirmation calls to the hotel I had made it known that the trip was both a wedding anniversary and birthday celebration in the hope that the hotel would at least place some flowers in our room (which I would have been happy to pay for) but no that was obviously too much to ask for.
reviews.title: Poor, poor staff

likes.liked: — The size of the room was adequate
likes.disliked: — The room was dark and dungeon-like and the staff was totally indifferent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only positive I can add to this review is that the location of this hotel is perfect for the sights and the breakfast is to a good standard; just don't expect good customer care.
reviews.title: Charming but hopeless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked to stay at the Uyan Hotel for 6 nights in early October. At check-in, we were shown to a dark, dreary room totally surrounded by high walls.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

reviews.text: When we requested a room change, we were told we would be able to move the following morning, which satisfied us. The next morning, we asked about the change and were then told it would be impossible (even though we had 5 nights remaining) as they were fully booked. At the time of this conversation, two separate couples were waiting to check out.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went over spring beak last March. Since we were on a students budget, this proved to be the most economical-yet-nice hotel I could find. The prices were great, the location great, and the rooms and hotel decor in general were beautiful. I don't like to stay in squalor even though I am a poor student..and while this was a little more expensive than a hostel, it was still affordable for us, and we got SO much for our money.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel for a decent price!
I could not have been more pleased!
